results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: UNICEF, John Luck and David Keith Hardy
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: UNICEF, John Luck and David Keith Hardy

results.title: A Gourmet tour. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Gian Manara
results.brief_description: The last decade has seen the emergence of an exciting and unique cuisine in Australia, arising from the multi-cultural nature of our society and the abundance of fresh, natural ingredients. This program is a gourmet’s tour of some of the best restaurants in the forefront of this development. It profiles the style of these famous restaurants, their chefs and details how to prepare some of their favourite dishes. Divided into three sections: Dining in Sydney and Dining with wine. Restaurants include Cleopatra’s, The Cellar, Berowra Waters, Taylors, Bangkok, The Barn, Cotswold House and Craigmoor.

results.title: A Good catch: a film about modern fishing nets and lines
results.brief_description: Shows a new British development in fishing equipment, the use of high density polyethylene as a material for fishing nets and lines. It shows conversion into filament, the weaving of the net and the use of this type of net and line. The fishing scenes were shot off Aslesund, Norway and north of the Arctic Circle in the Lofoten Islands.

results.title: A Good beginning
results.creator_credit: Modern Management Films and Norwood Studios
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the right way to induct and train employees on new jobs. Seen through the eyes of a young girl hired to learn a data processing card-punch operation. Compares correct techniques with wrong techniques. Reminds supervisors of the need to relieve tensions in the new employee before useful training can begin.

results.title: A Goal to win
results.brief_description: A must for every school and netball club. “A Goal to Win” is unique in its concept as a training video. Some of the exciting aspects covered are: Concentration, Individual Fitness, Team Cohesion, Self-Discipline, Team Tactics, Individual Skills, Motivation and Training Routines. The video traces players from beginners to elite players.

results.title: A Glittering song
results.creator_credit: Praha Loutkovy Film and Short Film Studio
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film in which bits of coloured glass and graphic art appear, change, and shift in an endless variety of patterns. This live action documentary technique creates a fantasy world of colour, light and form with a slight thread of story involving a child.

results.title: A Glimpse at a thousand points
results.brief_description: A discussion of the discoveries of the light deflector. Cathodes ray tube and photocell lead to a simple explanation of how television works and modern developments in television technology.

results.title: A Girl of the bush
results.brief_description: Lorna Denver is the wealthy manager of Kangaroo Flat sheep station. Rivalry arises when two men seek her hand in marriage. A melodramatic tale of romance with elements of social comment and some atmospheric outback locations.
results.description: Lorna Denver is the wealthy manager of Kangaroo Flat sheep station. Rivalry arises when two men seek her hand in marriage. A melodramatic tale of romance with elements of social comment and some atmospheric outback locations.

results.title: A Girl in black = To Koritsi me ta mavra [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Hermes Films, Anis Nohra and Michael Cacoyannis
results.brief_description: The first international Greek art-house success, “A Girl in Black” was filmed by Michael Cacoyannis on the Greek island of Hydra over eight weeks and using only one camera. The paucity of resources and budget, however, suit the intimate story of a young woman, Marina (Ellie Lambetti), whose mother’s promiscuity results in the community shunning the whole family. Cacoyannis would continue to explore the misogyny and sexism of traditional cultures in subsequent films, but on its release, “A Girl in Black” became a cause-celebre in Greece for daring to tackle the subject of women’s oppression on the Aegean islands. Marina’s dutiful suffering might appear melodramatic to a contemporary audience but there is no denying the still startling beauty of Walter Lassally’s cinematography which renders the lanes and cliffs of Hydra in such stark contrasts of black and white that the settings seem almost mythic in their majesty. Lambetti’s performance emerges largely from her expressive terrified eyes. Eleni Zafiriou’s portrayal of Mariana’s mother still challenges a contemporary audience, still so unused are we to representations of women’s sexual hunger. Though the script shares some of the patriarchal attitudes that it condemns in the islanders, Zafiriou transcends the filmmakers’ condemnation of the mother’s sexuality by imbuing her with humanity and tenderness. George Foundas is also equally fine as the macho fisherman whose rejection by Marina initiates the tragic events that unfold on the island. Winner of the Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film. In Greek with English subtitles.
